ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 1.  Your child often refrains from doing something because they are afraid of getting into trouble
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;  2 = Disagree;  3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: 2.  The good prospect of obtaining a reward motivates your child strongly to do some things
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;  2 = Disagree;  3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: 3.  Your child prefers not to ask for something when they are not sure they will obtain it
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;  2 = Disagree;  3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: 4.  Your child responds strongly to praise from friends or family
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;  2 = Disagree;  3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: 5. Your child is often afraid of new or unexpected situations
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;  2 = Disagree;  3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: 6.  Your child often gives in to avoid a quarrel
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;  2 = Disagree;  3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: 7. Your child often does things to be praised
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;  2 = Disagree;  3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Agree; 5 = Strongly agree
